name: Vivianna Torun Bülow-Hübe
biography:
Vivianna Torun Bülow-Hube is one of Sweden’s most important 20th century silversmiths and jewelers. She is the first female silversmith to become internationally famous. Torun, as she was known, attended the Stockholm University of Arts, Crafts and Design and soon after opened her own studio, becoming the first female silversmith with a private workshop in Sweden.  Torun was active in Sweden, France, Germany and Indonesia. She produced jewelry, watches, and tableware for many celebrities, including Ingrid Bergman and Pablo Picasso, among others. Some of her pieces became world-renown for their revolutionary design. For example, “Mobius,” a necklace with a crystal drop was to be draped over the shoulder; her bangle-style wristwatch became the first watch ever to be produced by Georg Jensen.
Her innovative designs earned her several awards throughout her career.
